intro: Gaultheria divergens, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wintergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere, including parts of North America and Asia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically narrow and have a leathery texture, while its berries are dark red and contain a single seed. Gaultheria divergens is often found in acidic soils and is adapted to grow in shaded, forested environments.
